meta.title: Use of Crude Drug Storage Cabinet

sections.purpose: To store authenticated crude drug samples in a protected, organized manner.
sections.scope: Applicable to maintenance of pharmacognostic specimen collections and working samples.
procedure: Label each shelf or compartment with the crude drug name and code number.
Store crude drugs in clean, dry, airtight containers or packets with proper labeling.
Arrange materials alphabetically or by family for easy retrieval.
Inspect stored samples periodically for signs of insect infestation, mold, or deterioration.
Record incoming and outgoing samples in a logbook or inventory system.
Clean the cabinet surfaces and corners regularly to prevent dust and pests.
precautions: Avoid exposure of crude drugs to direct sunlight and excessive humidity.
Do not store insecticides or chemicals in the same cabinet as crude drugs.
Use insect repellents or desiccants where necessary, ensuring they do not contact the samples.
Handle fragile specimens such as flowers and leaves with care.
Maintain restricted access if rare or reference specimens are stored.
